articles.title: Earth gazing: Views from 1st German rockets to NASA’s 100-million-mile missions - CNBCTV18
articles.description: From early balloon launches to modern deep-space missions, our view of Earth has expanded dramatically. Images captured from 100 miles to 100 million miles away reveal the planet’s beauty.
articles.content: Captured by a German V-2 rocket, this photo marked the dawn of high-altitude Earth imaging, offering a glimpse from 65 miles above.
